meanings.definition: To reduce the merit or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: By constantly criticizing her work, he was demeriting her efforts.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments demerited the overall performance of the team.
meanings.sent3: His habit of pointing out flaws was demeriting the joy of the project.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to demerit the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the statue demerited its historical significance.

meanings.definition: To detract from the value or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: Her absence demerited the success of the event.
meanings.sent2: Adding too many ads can demerit the user experience of the website.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbors demerited the peacefulness of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The outdated design demerited the appeal of the product.
meanings.sent5: The scratch on the car demerited its resale value.
